title: JS Tech Talk: CI/CD 101
details:
Details
-------

Welcome to JS Tech Talk: "CI/CD 101" with Niall Byrne.

Do you find Devops or CI/CD intimidating? Whether new, novice or intermediateâ€“this talk is for you!

Let's clarify the foundations that CI/CD is built on and look a little deeper than the tools available to automate deployments. We'll explore the actual habits, strategies and best practices that have become ubiquitous on software development teams.

Understanding the problems that gave rise to CI/CD can make you a better developer, and ultimately, a more effective team member if you land at a company that employs these practices.

Schedule:

6:30 - "doors" open, Intros

6:45 - Talk begins.

8:30 - Q&A moderated by your organizers.

9:00-End - Chit chat and breakout conversation with other members. You know, the usual breakout rooms and "networking".

Speaker Bio:

Niall Byrne is a Toronto-based software developer, who has been helping solve software, network and infrastructure challenges for about 10 years. He also enjoys new music, and studying Korean.

Code of conduct is enforced at all TorontoJS events [https://torontojs.com/p/code\_of\_conduct](https://torontojs.com/p/code_of_conduct)

Interested in speaking?

Please email us at [team@torontojs.com](http://team@torontojs.com) for more information. All skill levels are welcome for talks and workshops!

Join us on Slack: [http://slack.torontojs.com/](http://slack.torontojs.com/)
